About

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to.

Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. You can change or withdraw your consent at any time from the Cookie Declaration on our website.

Frequently asked questions
--------------------------

###### Is the free trial really free?

Yes! Definitely. The free trial is without any strings attached and automatically expires after 14 days. Organize as many webinars as you like and try all features.

###### Am I bound to long contracts?

Nope! Certainly not. Payments are either monthly or annually and you can cancel, upgrade or downgrade at any time.

###### How can I pay for my WebinarGeek subscription?

You can pay via credit card (Visa, Mastercard, AMEX, JDC, Discover) or direct debit. To start direct debit payments, you have to complete your first payment via iDEAL, Bancontact, or Sofort.

###### Do you offer special prices for non-profit organisations?

Yes, [contact](https://www.webinargeek.com/contact) us for special offers for non-profit organisations. It will be required to show your tax-free status with fiscal documents from the country of your organisation.

###### Do you offer a Data Processing Agreement?

Certainly! In your account you can find it under 'Privacy & Security'.

###### Do you offer the tools to make my webinars GDPR-proof?

Definitely. You can add consent fields to your registration form to make sure that people only subscribe to your mailing list after their explicit consent. We also give you the tools to perform and share data lookups.

###### What happens with my account if I cancel my subscription?

Your account remains accessible to you. You can access all your data collected around your webinars. It will not be possible to host a live webinar and recordings will also not be accessible for viewers anymore. After two weeks we will remove your webinars. This is in line with the GDPR to not retain data for an unnecessary long period. You can of course still activate your subscription to start hosting webinars again!

###### I am not hosting webinars very frequently, how can I retain my data?

We understand your needs and that's why we offer a 'pause' subscription for a small fee. You can still access your account and we will keep your webinars, statistics, and much more safe!

###### Are you planning to host just one webinar or event?

We’d love to hear more about your plans! While WebinarGeek is built on a subscription model to help you consistently engage your audience and maximize your content’s value, we understand that every situation is unique. [Let’s chat to explore](https://www.webinargeek.com/pricing?chat=open) options that work for your live event needs.

###### Do you want to host webinars for other companies?

View our special [Partner Program](https://www.webinargeek.com/pricing-av) and take advantage of exclusive benefits.

Try it now
----------

14 days free. All Premium features. No strings attached.

Frequently asked questions
--------------------------

###### Is the free trial really free?

Yes! Definitely. The free trial is without any strings attached and automatically expires after 14 days. Organize as many webinars as you like and try all features.

###### Am I bound to long contracts?

Nope! Certainly not. Payments are either monthly or annually and you can cancel, upgrade or downgrade at any time.

###### How can I pay for my WebinarGeek subscription?

You can pay via credit card (Visa, Mastercard, AMEX, JDC, Discover) or direct debit. To start direct debit payments, you have to complete your first payment via iDEAL, Bancontact, or Sofort.

###### Do you offer special prices for non-profit organisations?

Yes, [contact](https://www.webinargeek.com/contact) us for special offers for non-profit organisations. It will be required to show your tax-free status with fiscal documents from the country of your organisation.

###### Do you offer a Data Processing Agreement?

Certainly! In your account you can find it under 'Privacy & Security'.

###### Do you offer the tools to make my webinars GDPR-proof?

Definitely. You can add consent fields to your registration form to make sure that people only subscribe to your mailing list after their explicit consent. We also give you the tools to perform and share data lookups.

###### What happens with my account if I cancel my subscription?

Your account remains accessible to you. You can access all your data collected around your webinars. It will not be possible to host a live webinar and recordings will also not be accessible for viewers anymore. After two weeks we will remove your webinars. This is in line with the GDPR to not retain data for an unnecessary long period. You can of course still activate your subscription to start hosting webinars again!

###### I am not hosting webinars very frequently, how can I retain my data?

We understand your needs and that's why we offer a 'pause' subscription for a small fee. You can still access your account and we will keep your webinars, statistics, and much more safe!

###### Are you planning to host just one webinar or event?

We’d love to hear more about your plans! While WebinarGeek is built on a subscription model to help you consistently engage your audience and maximize your content’s value, we understand that every situation is unique. [Let’s chat to explore](https://www.webinargeek.com/pricing?chat=open) options that work for your live event needs.

###### Do you want to host webinars for other companies?

View our special [Partner Program](https://www.webinargeek.com/pricing-av) and take advantage of exclusive benefits.
